Infosys surged 3% post US share hike, boosting FY25 outlook. Tech Mahindra, Power Grid, Tata Steel, NTPC, JSW Steel lagged. HCL Tech, Asian Paints, HDFC Bank benefited from demand recovery.

title: Stocks in news: RIL, Wipro, Paytm, Infosys, Tata Technologies
content: Nifty50 reaches 24,800; RIL, Wipro, Infosys, Tata Technologies reveal first-quarter results. Vodafone Idea issues Rs 615 crore in equity shares. Infosys records 3.6% revenue growth, broad-based in constant currency. Tata Technologies' profit falls 15%. CIE Automotive earns Rs 217 crore. JSW Steel's results await.

title: IT stocks lead D-Street charge as rate cut speculation mounts
content: The 30-share BSE Sensex rose by 52 points, or 0.06%, to close at 80,716, while the broader NSE Nifty increased by 26 points, or 0.11%, finishing at 24,613. In the Sensex pack, HUL, Bharti Airtel, Tech Mahindra, Infosys, M&M, and ICICI Bank recorded gains. Conversely, Kotak Mahindra Bank, NTPC, Reliance Industries, UltraTech Cements, and Power Grid saw declines.

title: Nifty continues record run, scales 24,650 mark; Sensex rises 100 points
content: Indian indices rose 0.12%, with Sensex gaining 97 points and Nifty 50 reaching a new July record, up 29 points at 9:22 am, trading at 24,615. Nifty rose in 8 out of 12 July sessions. Bharti Airtel, Adani Ports, Tata Steel, and Bajaj Finserv led gains, while HCL Tech, L&T, Tata Motors, and Nestle India saw losses.

title: SBI, NTPC catapult Sensex, Nifty to  historic highs; investors reap Rs 2.7 lakh crore reward
content: The 30-share benchmark index jumped 145 points to settle at 80,665. The broader NSE Nifty gained 84 points to strengthen its hold above 24,580. From the Sensex pack, SBI, NTPC, and UltraTech Cement were the top gainers, rising 2-2.5%. M&M, Bajaj Finance, Tata Motors, and Maruti Suzuki also closed with gains

title: Tech stocks boost Nifty to fresh lifetime high, Sensex rises 200 pts
content: Nifty50 hit a record high driven by IT stocks on U.S. rate cut hopes. HCL Tech and BSE Sensex rose. Nifty IT, Auto sectors rose; Private Bank, FMCG, Realty sectors saw cuts. HCL, SBI, Infosys, Tech Mahindra gained. Likely 25 basis point rate cut amid rising food prices.

title: US inflation data, IT stocks propel Indian indices to fresh highs
content: The NSE Nifty rose 186.20 points, or 0.77%, to close at 24,502.15, having hit a lifetime high of 24,592.20 during the day. The BSE Sensex rose 622 points, or 0.78%, to end at 80,519.34, down from an intraday record of 80,893.51.

title: TCS Q1 beat fuels market rally, lifts Sensex, Nifty and m-cap to new records
content: The market capitalization of all BSE-listed companies reached a record high, increasing by Rs 1.18 lakh crore to Rs 452.36 lakh crore. TCS, India's leading IT services company, saw a 6.7% rise after surpassing revenue expectations. This surge contributed to a 4.25% increase in the US rate-sensitive IT index.

title: IT stocks surge up to 6% led by midcap counter Mphasis as TCS Q1 cheers D-Street
content: Indian IT stocks surged due to TCS's robust June quarter earnings. The Nifty IT index rose 3.7%. Infosys and TCS led gains with Rs 62,613 crore revenue and Rs 12,040 crore net profit. MphasiS had notable intraday gains, while HCL Technologies showed growth. TCS forecasts better FY25 performance.

title: TCS, Infy power D-Street to fresh record highs! Sensex soars 900 points, Nifty tops 24,500 for the first time
content: Indian markets rose Friday, led by TCS's strong June quarter. Sensex climbed 281 points, Nifty50 up 93 points. Stocks like TCS, Infosys, and Adani Ports surged. Maruti fell. US inflation data raised September Fed rate cut chances, noted by CME FedWatch. RBI's Das predicted 5% retail inflation. Powell's testimony hinted at possible rate cuts.

title: Hot Stocks: Brokerage view on Emami, Godrej Consumer, Affle, Tech Mahindra, and others
content: Citi maintains a sell rating on Persistent (TP: Rs 3,080). Q1 shows strong growth but expects sequential margin decline, with Q2 at risk due to wage hikes. Market worries over FY25 margins and stable TCV. Despite a 24% rise, stock beats IT index by 17%. UBS reiterates buy on Dr. Lal Path Labs (TP: Rs 3,500). Potential growth reinvestment not priced in, Tier-3 markets perform well.

title: Sensex rises over 200 pts, Nifty above 24,350 in hopes of dovish stance from Fed
content: Indian indices rose as markets expected dovish signals from U.S. Fed Chair Powell. Sensex up 223 points to 80,184, Nifty50 up 59 points. Key gainers included Maruti Suzuki, M&M, Adani Ports, while Tech Mahindra, JSW Steel fell. Soft inflation increased odds of U.S. rate cut to 74%. Century Textiles rose 4%. Budget, Q1 results closely watched.

title: Sensex, Nifty end flat after scaling fresh highs; HDFC Bank plays spoilsport
content: The Nifty breadth was skewed in the favour of the bears, with 27 stocks ending in the red, while 23 ended in positive territory. Top gainers at the close included Tata Motors, HCL Technologies, ICICI Bank, Sun Pharmaceuticals, and Tata Consultancy Services (TCS).

title: M&M, Power Grid, 11 other stocks outperform Sensex in its fastest 10,000 points marathon
content: As a NEWS EDITOR, investors are urged by Nilesh Shah to maintain a long-term perspective and proper asset allocation as Sensex reaches the 80,000 milestone. He draws parallels with Nasdaq's history and notes Gold's outperformance compared to Nifty in the first half of 2024.

title: IT stocks rally up to 32% in 1 month. Will Q1 results mark end of sluggish revenue growth?
content: IT sector experiences bullish rally ahead of Q1 results with Tech Mahindra, Coforge, and Infosys emerging as top stock recommendations.

title: Infosys, Tech Mahindra among 6 IT stocks that could surprise positively in Q1 results: JM Financial
content: Stating that Tech Mahindra remains a ‘buy' on turnaround hopes while KPIT Technologies and Tata Technologies are structural bets on auto ER&D theme, domestic brokerage firm JM Financial believes that Q1 results for the IT sector could positively surprise the street.

title: Banking stocks lift Sensex, Nifty to new heights in July opening
content: D-Sreet closed on a positive note on Monday, with the S&P BSE Sensex gaining 443.46 points to settle at 79,476.19. The broader Nifty index also rose, adding 131.35 points to close at 24,141.95. The banking sector showed particular strength, with the banking gauge up by 0.44%. Tech Mahindra, Wipro, Bajaj Finance, Grasim Industries, and UltraTech Cement were among the top gainers, while NTPC, Eicher Motors, Apollo Hospitals Enterprise, SBI, and Dr. Reddy's Laboratories experienced declines. Market capitalisation of all the BSE listed companies increased by Rs 344,798 crore.

title: 187 BSE500 stocks offer double digit returns as markets scaled new heights in June
content: The India Cements was the top gainer in this pack with nearly 44% return, followed by Amara Raja Energy (41%), JK Paper (40.5%), and V Mart Retail (40.5%).

title: F&O stocks to buy today: IGL, Tech Mahindra among top 8 trading ideas for 28 June 2024
content: The Nifty future closed positive with gains of 0.75% at 24047 levels on Thursday. India VIX was up by 0.78% from 14.04 to 14.15 levels.

title: Hot Stocks: Brokerage view on Bandhan Bank, HDFC Bank, Tech Mahindra and Amara Raja
content: Brokerage firms like Citigroup, JPMorgan, and Bernstein provide ratings on Tech Mahindra, Amara Raja Batteries, and HDFC Bank. ETNow and other sources collated the recommendations, including Citigroup's sell rating on Tech Mahindra with a raised target price.

title: Adani Ports enters Sensex, Wipro exits as part of semi-annual rejig
content: Adani Ports joins Sensex as Wipro exits. The inclusion of APSEZ brings $259 million in passive inflows. Seven stocks' weights to rise: Bharti Airtel, Infosys, Kotak Mahindra Bank, ICICI Bank, Tech Mahindra, Tata Steel, and IndusInd Bank.

title: Q1 results, IPO action among 10 factors that will steer D-Street this week
content: The Street will react to major earnings reports from SBI, Divi’s Laboratories, Titan, and Britannia when markets resume trading on Monday. Additionally, 922 BSE-listed companies will announce April-June earnings, including Bharti Airtel and Tata Power. Indian markets will take cues from US market closures and GIFT Nifty futures.

title: Titan Q1 Results: Standalone net profit falls marginally YoY to Rs 770 crore, revenue rises by 9%
content: Titan Q1 Results: Titan's EBIT grew 9.1% to Rs 1,203 crore. The jewellery segment saw a 9% increase in total income, with India operations growing 8%. Watches & Wearables reported a 15% growth in total income, with the domestic business rising by 14%. Titan's EyeCare segment saw a 3% increase in total income, reaching Rs 209 crore, with an EBIT of Rs 20 crore and a 9.6% margin for Q1.

title: Share market update: Most active stocks of the day in terms of total traded value
content: The NSE Nifty index was trading 10.96 points  down  at 24468.1

title: Titan shares fall 4% as weak Q1 update leads to target price cuts
content: Titan Share Price: Titan Company's shares dropped 4% on Monday due to lower-than-expected business growth, prompting target price cuts from global brokerages. The company reported varied performance in different divisions, with challenges like high gold prices affecting consumer demand.

title: RIL, M&M contribute nearly 3,000 points to the 10K rally of Sensex
content: Reliance Industries was the top contributor adding 1,927 points. The country’s largest company by revenue and market capitalisation gained 26.3% since December 11, 2023 when the Sensex had touched 70,000 for the first time.

title: HDFC Bank leads financial sector rally, powering D-Street to all-time highs
content: The 30-stock S&P BSE Sensex reached a record high of 80,074.3 before closing the session at 79,987, up by 545 points or 0.69%. Meanwhile, the broader Nifty hit a peak of 24,309.15 before ending the day at 24,287, gaining 163 points or 0.67%.

title: Block deals worth over Rs 40,543 crore this week. Indus Towers, HAL, Suzlon Energy among stocks with major action
content: Despite the Nifty index closing the shortened trading week with a slight increase of 0.4%, significant activity was observed in block deals. Over three dozen companies across various market caps saw block deals worth a total of ₹40,543 crore, involving both buying and selling.

title: Hot Stocks: Brokerage view on Tata Motors, Titan, IndusInd Bank and GMR Airports
content: Jefferies bullish on GMR Airports, targets Rs 100; expansion at Delhi/Hyderabad Airports to boost growth. GIL and GAL merger nearing completion. Morgan Stanley neutral on Titan Company targets of Rs 3,526; management emphasizes long-term jewelry business strategy.

title: Hot Stocks: Brokerages view on Aurobindo Pharma, Apollo Hospitals, Suzlon & Titan Company
content: Top brokerage firms like Macquarie maintained an outperform rating on Aurobindo Pharma, raising the target price to Rs 1,385. Aurobindo Pharma signed a master service agreement with Merck Sharp & Dohme, leading to a biologics CMO contract with TheraNym.

title: Rekha Rakesh Jhunjhunwala earns Rs 224 crore dividend from Rs 38,000 crore portfolio in March quarter
content: Rekha Jhunjhunwala likely earned Rs 224 crore dividend from her Rs 37,831 crore portfolio in the March quarter, including from companies like Titan Company, Canara Bank, and Valor Estate. She holds stakes in various companies and saw changes in shareholding in Agro Tech Foods and Nazara Technologies.

title: Titan plunges 7.2% on profitability worries, analysts cut price targets
content: "Aggressive store expansion by existing players and entry of new player (e.g., Novel Jewels by Aditya Birla Group will invest ₹5,000 cr) may keep competitive intensity elevated," said Citi's analysts in a client note.

title: Share market update: Most active stocks of the day in terms of traded value
content: The NSE Nifty index closed 33.15 points  down  at 22442.7

title: Equity investors become poorer by Rs 7.93 lakh cr in three days
content: The market capitalisation (mcap) of BSE-listed companies was eroded by Rs 7,93,529.61 crore to Rs 3,94,25,823.46 (USD 4.75 trillion) in three days.

title: Sensex, Nifty end lower after hitting record highs, snap 3-session record run
content: Indian indices fell from lifetime highs to end lower. Auto and FMCG stocks pressured the market. Out of the 15 Nifty sectoral indices, seven closed with cuts.

title: Titan Q4 Update: Revenue grows 17% YoY; 86 stores added
content: Watches & Wearables domestic business surged 7% year-on-year, comprising 7% revenue growth in analogue watches and 2% in wearables.

title: ITC, ICICI Bank and Titan among 25 stocks in Rahul Gandhi's Rs 4.30 crore stock portfolio
content: INC leader Rahul Gandhi's disclosed Rs 4.30 crore stock portfolio, which includes various companies like Suprajit Engineering, ITC, ICICI Bank, Alkyl Amines, Bajaj Finance, Tata Consultancy Services, Britannia Industries, and Titan Company.

title: Zomato, SBI, ITC among Motilal Oswal’s top 11 largecap picks
content: Nifty is currently trading at a 12-month forward PE of 19.4x versus LPA of 20.3x. Motilal Oswal selects 11 largecap stocks as its top ideas, Of these two are non-Nifty players

title: Setback or blip? Decoding jewellery stocks’ underperformance as gold hits fresh lifetime highs
content: ETMarkets' analysis reveals the underperformance of jewellery stocks amidst gold's record highs. Most saw negative returns, with a few exceptions. Experts suggest cautious investment strategies with focus on companies' fundamentals and long-term prospects.

title: IT bluechips drag Sensex over 400 points lower, Nifty below 21,950
content: Despite losses, the Nifty breadth remained positive with 31 stocks trading in the green while remaining 19 in the red. The top five losers were all IT counters viz. HCL Technologies, Infosys, Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), Wipro and LTIMindtree while the top gainers were Sun Pharmaceuticals, Cipla, UPL, Bharti Airtel and Titan Company.

title: Despite misses, top brokerages retain ratings on Titan. Should you buy, sell or hold?
content: On Thursday, Titan reported a 9% year-on-year (YoY) growth in its standalone net profit at Rs 1,040 crore in the third quarter. It was Rs 951 crore a year ago. The profit figure was lower than the ET NOW poll estimate of Rs 1,159 crore. Revenue from operations jumped 20% YoY to Rs 13,052 crore in the reporting quarter, compared with Rs 10,875 crore in the last year quarter.

title: Hot Stocks: Brokerages view on Indian Hotels, Titan Company, Paytm and Dr Lal PathLabs
content: Goldman Sachs maintained a sell rating on Dr Lal PathLabs with a target price of Rs 2200. The company reported a subdued volume growth and the trend continues.

title: Technical Breakout Stocks: How to trade Bharti Airtel, L&T and Titan Company on Tuesday?
content: Indian headline indices ended in the red on Saturday conceding their morning gains amid selling pressure in FMCG, IT and pharma sectors despite a good show by banks.

title: Hot Stocks: Brokerages on IndusInd Bank, Rallis India, Titan Company and IGL
content: The global investment bank expects favorable outlook for volume growth in FY25E, which would indicate business as usual.

title: Ahead of Market: 10 things that will decide D-Street action on Wednesday
content: Nifty on Tuesday ended 65 points lower to face resistance around the psychological level of 22,000. The hourly momentum indicator has triggered a negative crossover, indicating loss of momentum on the upside.

title: Titan Company shares hit 52-week high on Q3 updates
content: With a return of over 50% in the past 12 months, Titan shares have outperformed the Nifty which has delivered nearly 20% returns during this period.

title: Hot Stocks: Brokerage views on Marico, GCPL and Titan
content: Morgan Stanley has maintained an Equal weight' stance on the Marico stock for a price target of Rs 553. In a note it said that the environment of no to low top-line growth persists which is a constraint on profitability in the general trade channel and remains an overhang for the FMCG sector as a whole.

title: Sensex, Nifty open with minor gains amid pressure in financial stocks
content: The market breadth was skewed in favour of the bulls with 30 stocks trading in the green. Bharat Petroleum Corporation (BPCL), Eicher Motors, Titan Company, Adani Ports and ONGC were among the top gainers while Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), Bajaj Finance, Infosys, Divi's Laboratories and Tata Consumer Products were among the top laggards.

title: Titan Q3 Update: Company sees 22% revenue growth on strong all-round show
content: Titan added a total of 90 stores during the quarter, taking the group's total presence to 2,949 stores. At the end of the September quarter, Titan had 2,859 stores.

title: In Sensex’s journey from 40k to 70k, these 7 index superstar stocks outshined; did you know?
content: ​These seven stocks have given more than 15% returns during each of the 10000-point rally Sensex saw from 40000 levels, and they are Titan Company, Sun Pharmaceutical Industries, ICICI Bank, Bharti Airtel, UltraTech Cement, JSW Steel, and Nestle India.

title: Ahead of Market: 10 things that will decide D-Street action on Friday
content: India's benchmark equity indices declined on Thursday after rallying for seven consecutive sessions, as investors took a breather a day before the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI’s) monetary policy decision.

title: Ahead of Market: 10 things that will decide D-Street action on Wednesday
content: Nifty on Tuesday ended 89 points stronger to form a small positive candle with an upper shadow on the daily chart.  The short-term trend of Nifty continues to be range-bound

title: Titan gets CCI nod for additional stake purchase in CaratLane
content: The combination relates to the acquisition of 27.18 per cent share capital of CaratLane (a subsidiary of Titan) by Titan Company Ltd, on a fully diluted basis, from Mithun Padam Sacheti, Siddhartha Padam Sacheti, and Padamchand Sacheti, according to a release

title: Q2 Earnings Review: Titan Company, UltraTech Cements could give 14-16% return in 1 year
content: Sales/EBITDA/PBT/PAT growth for Nifty constituents was marginally better than our estimates at +5%/+21%/+27%/+28% YoY in 2QFY24.

title: F&O stocks to buy or sell today: Titan, Tata Power among top 6 trading ideas for 17 November
content: Call writing is seen at 19900 then 20000 strikes while Put writing is seen at 19700 and then towards 19600 strikes.

title: Ahead of Market: 10 things that will decide D-Street action on Friday
content: The NSE Nifty 50 index settled 0.46% higher at 19,765, while the S&P BSE Sensex rose 0.47% to 65,982, notching their highest closes since October 17.

title: Morgan Stanley sees India outperforming China in 2024; adds RIL, DMart to focus list
content: India has delivered strong relative earnings, sustaining the strong market outperformance seen in 2022, while macro-fundamentals have withstood tightening financial conditions in the US. “India is set to establish secular economic and earnings outperformance vs EM,” the investment bank said in its 2024 outlook report.

title: 3 Tata cos among 9 Nifty stocks that saw over 5% upgrade in FY24 EPS estimates
content: Brokerage Motilal Oswal has upgraded EPS estimates of nine Nifty stocks. The list includes state-run Coal India, auto major Maruti Suzuki and JSW Steel. Coal India topped the charts with an EPS upgrade of 18.1%. Others with over 5% upgrades include Maruti Suzuki (10.2%), JSW Steel (8.2%), Cipla (7%), Hero MotoCorp (6.9%) and Mahindra & Mahindra (5.3%).

title: F&O stocks to buy & sell today: UPL, HDFC Bank among top 7 trading ideas for 2 August
content: The Indian market experienced a significant decline on Friday, with the BSE Sensex falling 814 points and Nifty50 down 282 points. Analysts identified crucial support and resistance levels, suggesting trading strategies for stocks like HDFC Bank and Bata India. Expert recommendations included specific targets and stop-loss levels for various stocks.

title: Hot Stocks: Brokerages view on AB Capital, Zomato, UPL and Varun Beverages
content: BofA Securities upheld a buy rating for Varun Beverages, while Jefferies suggested buying Zomato. AB Capital received an Equal Weight rating from Morgan Stanley, and Motilal Oswal advised a neutral stance on UPL.

title: UPL to file DRHP shortly for raising up to $500 million
content: The company has already secured its board's approval for the issue, which may hit the market by early third quarter of this fiscal, UPL Ltd CFO Anand Vora said at the company's post-Q4 earnings announcement media briefing

title: UPL Q4 results: Profit falls 95% YoY to Rs 40 cr; revenue down 15%
content: UPL reported a significant 95% YoY drop in consolidated net profit to Rs 40 crore for Q4FY24, with revenue from operations also declining 15% YoY to Rs 14,078 crore. This decrease is attributed to lower post-patent market prices.

title: Q4 results today: Zomato, Varun Beverages among 59 companies to announce earnings on Monday
content: 59 companies, including Zomato and Varun Beverages, to reveal Q4 results for March 2024. Jindal Steel, Tube Investments, AB Capital also share earnings. Zomato expects 75% y-o-y revenue growth, 48% q-o-q net profit rise.

title: Maruti Suzuki breaches Rs 4 lakh crore m-cap mark as stock races to fresh 52-week high
content: Maruti Suzuki India's shares rose 4% to hit a new 52-week high, joining the club of stocks with a market capitalization of Rs 4 lakh crore, such as Reliance Industries and Larsen & Toubro.

title: Shriram Finance to replace UPL from Nifty tomorrow, likely to see $260 million inflows
content: Shriram Finance to replace UPL in Nifty, which could trigger inflows. HDFC Bank, Jio Financial, Adani Power to benefit from rebalancing. PSU pack to see weight adjustments. Nuvama estimates significant inflows and outflows in index reshuffle.

title: Shriram Finance may see $260 million in inflows post Nifty inclusion
content: The highest inflows across all indices are expected from Shriram Finance, HDFC Bank, and Jio Financial Services. The highest outflows are expected to be from SBI, UPL, and ICICI Bank. NTPC could see an inflow of $ 71 million due to an increase in weightage in the Nifty CPSE Index.

title: NSE Rejig: $94 million cumulative passive inflows seen in NTPC, 2 other PSU stocks, says Nuvama
content: NTPC's weight on the Nifty CPSE is expected to go up 20% versus the current weight of 17.9%. As for NHPC and NLC, the new weights post the readjustment will likely be 4.6% and 1.2%, respectively, versus 4.2% and 0.9%, now.

title: HDFC Bank, Jio Financial, Adani Power to be in focus ahead of Nifty rejig on Thursday
content: The rejig exercise will also see significant inflows in six other stocks viz. NTPC ($66 million), Power Finance Corporation (PFC, $45 million), REC ($43 million), Mahindra & Mahindra (M&M, $42 million) Bharti Airtel ($26 million) and Indian Railway Finance Corporation (IRFC $23 million).

title: IT bluechips drag Sensex over 400 points lower, Nifty below 21,950
content: Despite losses, the Nifty breadth remained positive with 31 stocks trading in the green while remaining 19 in the red. The top five losers were all IT counters viz. HCL Technologies, Infosys, Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), Wipro and LTIMindtree while the top gainers were Sun Pharmaceuticals, Cipla, UPL, Bharti Airtel and Titan Company.

title: Technical Breakout Stocks: How to trade Colgate-Palmolive, HUL and UPL on Friday
content: The Nifty50 rose 148 points to close at 22,146 while the S&P BSE Sensex rose 335 points to close at 73,097. Sectorally, buying was seen in telecom, utilities, oil & gas, and power stocks while selling was seen in banking stocks.

title: Stocks in news: Tata Motors, M&M, NLC India, UPL, Vedanta
content: Japan's Sumitomo Wiring Systems, a promoter in Samvardhana Motherson International, sold partial stake in the company through bulk deals on Wednesday.

title: Shriram Finance shares jump over 4% while UPL falls 2% on Nifty50 rejig
content: Shriram Finance Share Price: Shriram Finance's stock will replace UPL in the Nifty50 index from March 28. The stock has witnessed a strong rally and hit a 52-week high. It is currently trading above its moving averages. In other major indices, several stocks will be added and excluded.

title: Sensex, Nifty off to a muted start ahead of key macro data
content: From the Sensex pack, Reliance Industries, SBI, M&M, Titan, and IndusInd Bank opened with gains, while UltraTech Cement, Power Grid, Nestle India, and Tata Motors opened with cuts.

title: Stocks in news: RIL, Shriram Finance, GPT Healthcare, Coal India, Oil India
content: Shriram Finance Ltd will replace UPL Ltd in benchmark Nifty 50 index with effect from March 28, the National Stock Exchange said on Wednesday.

title: Shriram Finance to replace UPL in Nifty from March 28
content: According to the exchange's communication on Wednesday, Shriram Finance was included due to the highest six-month average free-float market capitalisation within the eligible universe.

title: Shriram Finance to replace UPL in Nifty50 from March 28
content: Shriram Finance has been included in Nifty50 index as it has the highest 6-month average free-float market capitalization within the eligible universe as a replacement to UPL Ltd, the bourse said. In Nifty Next 50, Adani Power, Indian Railway Finance Corporation, Jio Financial Services, Power Finance Corporation, and REC Ltd have been included

title: EPS downgrades exceed upgrades in 3 months
content: A Bloomberg earnings upgrade or downgrade is the consensus estimate by equity analysts tracking the stock, indicating expectations of higher or lower profits, respectively.

title: These 26 companies saw over 25% drop in Q3 sales, PAT; are they still worth betting on?
content: Around 26 companies, with a market capitalisation of over Rs 2,500 crore, reported atleast 25% year-on-year (YoY) fall in both revenue and profits in the last quarter, and a majority of them were part of the chemicals and pesticides sector.

title: Motilal tweaks FY25 earnings outlook of Tata Motors, ITC and 8 other companies after Q3 show
content: The aggregate earnings of the companies in the MOFSL universe exceeded expectations and rose 29% year-on-year (YoY) versus an estimated 19%. Earnings for the Nifty-50 jumped 17% YoY versus an estimated 11%.

title: Stocks in news: Entero Healthcare, YES Bank, Alpex Solar, Max Financial, UPL
content: Global private equity major Carlyle Group on Thursday sold 1.4% stake in private sector lender YES Bank for approximately Rs 1,057 crore.

title: F&O Ban List: Biocon, PNB among 12 stocks under trade ban on Friday
content: The F&O contracts of any stock enter the ban period when the open interest (OI) on it crosses 95% of the market-wide positions limits or MWPL. The ban on it is reversed only if the open interest falls below 80%.

title: Moody's downgrades UPL Corporation post weak operating results in Q3
content: The rating agency has downgraded to Ba1 from Baa3 the senior unsecured rating for UPL Corporation Limited, it said on Tuesday.

title: Big Movers on D-Street: What should investors do with IOB, Rites, and UPL?
content: The benchmark Nifty 50 ended 0.4% down at 21771.70 points, and the Sensex closed 0.5% lower at 71731.42 points. On the other hand, the Nifty PSE index closed 2% higher at 9189.20 points.

title: UPL Q3 Results: Co posts loss of Rs 1,217 crore against profit a year ago
content: The company's net profit stood at Rs 1,087 crore during the corresponding quarter of the previous financial year, the company said in a regulatory filing. Its revenue from operations declined 27.72% to Rs 9,887 crore in the quarter under review from Rs 13,679 crore a year ago.

title: Stocks in news: RIL, Tata Steel, UPL, Infosys, Adani Wilmar
content: Reliance Industries Ltd (RIL) and Walt Disney Co signed a non-binding term sheet in London last week to move ahead with plans to create India’s largest media and entertainment business, ET reported.

title: Shriram Finance may enter Nifty; Canara Bank could replace Bandhan in Nifty Bank
content: Shriram Finance, which has a market cap of Rs 75,215.33 crore, has surged nearly 50% over the last 12 months as against the 23% drop seen in UPL share price during this period. In the meantime, the returns by Nifty have been 13%

title: Stock market holiday: BSE, NSE to remain shut on Monday on account of Gurunanak Jayanti
content: In the entire calendar year, the market has 15 annual holidays in 2023, two more than last year. This year four market holidays fell on Saturdays and Sundays which are non-trading days in a week. Mahashivratri, Id-Ul-Fitr (Ramzan Id) and Muharram were observed on Saturdays and Diwali on Sunday

title: S&P BSE Sensex 50 rejig: LTIMindtree, BEL to enter; UPL, Dabur set to exit index on December 18
content: Shares of LTIMindtree jumped over 2% to the day's high of Rs 5638 on the BSE while BEL fell 1.4% to the day's low of Rs 143.95. Meanwhile, UPL traded flat though the bias was positive and Dabur India gained up to 0.40% to Rs 543.85 around 12 pm.

title: 3 Tata cos among 9 Nifty stocks that saw over 5% upgrade in FY24 EPS estimates
content: Brokerage Motilal Oswal has upgraded EPS estimates of nine Nifty stocks. The list includes state-run Coal India, auto major Maruti Suzuki and JSW Steel. Coal India topped the charts with an EPS upgrade of 18.1%. Others with over 5% upgrades include Maruti Suzuki (10.2%), JSW Steel (8.2%), Cipla (7%), Hero MotoCorp (6.9%) and Mahindra & Mahindra (5.3%).

title: Nifty can hit 19,500, a hold there can keep bears out: Analysts
content: ​After retesting the trendline support on the weekly chart, Apollo Hospital saw a sharp recovery. Bharti Airtel has formed a fresh buying pivot after a marginal retracement to the shortterm moving average on a weekly chart.

title: Shriram Finance likely to replace UPL in Nifty50
content: Shriram Finance could witness an inflow of up to $250 million from the passive funds if included in India's biggest index. Domestic and global passive funds, such as exchange-traded funds (ETFs), structure their portfolios based on these indices.

title: Hot Stocks: Brokerages view on TVS Motor, Bharti Airtel and Marico
content: US brokerage Jefferies has a buy view on TVS Motor, UPL and Marico while CLSA took a buy stance on Petronet LNG and Bharti Airtel ahead of telecom major’s Q2FY24 earnings later today.

title: UPL Q2 Results: Agro-chem maker posts surprise loss of Rs 189 crore on weak demand, destocking
content: UPL shares, which have lost nearly a quarter of their value so far this year, fell as much as 4.8% after the results. The Mumbai-based company's revenue from operations fell around 19% year-on-year to 101.70 billion rupees. Revenue from the biggest segment, crop protection, fell nearly 21%.

title: Ultratech to buy 33% stake in India Cements
content: UltraTech Cement's Board has approved purchasing a 32.72% stake in India Cements from promoters and associates, following its prior acquisition of a 22.77% stake. The deal, subject to regulatory approvals, will enhance UltraTech's capacity in Southern India. Chairman Kumar Mangalam Birla highlighted the economic and infrastructural benefits of this investment.

title: UltraTech Cement Q1 Results: Cons PAT rises marginally to Rs 1,697 crore, revenue up 2% YoY
content: The revenue from operations stood at Rs 18,070 crore, which represents a 2% increase compared to Rs 17,737 crore reported by the company in the corresponding quarter of the last financial year. On a sequential basis, the cons PAT was down by 25% over Rs 2,258 crore reported by the cement maker in Q4FY24.

title: Share market update: Most active stocks of the day in terms of total traded value
content: The NSE Nifty index was trading 98.3 points  up  at 23967.1

title: Data hints at bullish setup, Nifty headed for 23,560 & 23,890: Experts
content: Nifty's bullish setup is supported by strong technical indicators, with recommendations for specific stocks in FMCG, pharma, IT, auto, and power sectors for potential gains.

title: Grasim Q4 revenue at record Rs 37,727 crore
content: While operating profit of the flagship company of the Aditya Birla Group jumped by a little over a fourth to ₹6,196 crore during the quarter, also an all-time high, the net profit remained flat on year at ₹1,370 crore. Adjusted for an exceptional item charge of ₹538 crore, the bottomline rose by two-fifths on year.

title: Sensex rises 253 points on auto and metal gains, defying foreign outflows
content: M&M was the top gainer, rising 6% as its overall March quarter numbers led to target price hikes and upgrades. JSW Steel, UltraTech Cement, Kotak Bank, ITC, and Maruti also closed higher. The market capitalisation of all listed companies on BSE surged Rs 2.86 lakh crore to Rs 410.21 lakh crore.

title: UltraTech, AM Mining, others eye Vadraj Cement
content: AM Mining India, a joint venture between ArcelorMittal and Nippon Steel, Oaktree Capital-backed India Opportunities XII Investments, and Nirma group-backed Nuvoco Vistas Corporation submitted expressions of interest (EoIs). Naveen Jindal group company called Jindal Panther Cement, and PN Group-promoted CN Infrabuild also gave separate EoIs.

title: UltraTech Cement Q4 Results: Board approves dividend of Rs 70/share
content: The cement maker reported a Profit After Tax (PAT) of Rs 2,258 crore, up 36% YoY, beating the Street estimates of Rs 2,048 crore.

title: UltraTech Cement Q4 Results: Profit rises 36% YoY to Rs 2,258 crore, beats estimates
content: UltraTech Cement Q4 Results: UltraTech Cement's Q4 net profit surged 36% YoY to Rs 2,258 crore. Domestic sales reached 33.22 million tons of grey cement, with a total capacity of 140.8 MTPA and a 25.7% green power mix.

title: UltraTech Cement Q4 results today: PAT may rise 18% YoY to Rs 1,962 crore, 13% revenue uptick likely
content: UltraTech Cement Q4 Preview: UltraTech Cement is anticipated to see an 18% YoY net profit increase to Rs 1,962 crore in Q4FY24, with revenue reaching Rs 20,057 crore, up 8.50% YoY.

title: Kesoram plans to raise funds from Tata Cap to refinance its Rs 1,500-crore debt
content: The company is looking for a one-year finance before the asset moves to UltraTech following regulatory clearances, they said, adding that Kesoram is looking to refinance the debt at 12-13%. Talks for the new loan could close by the end of this month, Kesoram Industries added.

title: India’s infra push to put UltraTech on road to growth
content: In the post-earnings conference call, the UltraTech management said it expects capacity utilisation to improve close to 80-85% in the three months to March, from about 77% in the December 2023 quarter.

title: UltraTech Cement's Q3 earnings meet Street's estimates. Should you buy stock?
content: Ultratech Cement's stock fell over 1% to Rs 9,906 despite highest-ever net profit in Q4. BofA recommends buying at Rs 10,000 target, Nuvama suggests hold at Rs 9,121 target, and Sharekhan suggests buys at Rs 11,300 target. Q4 profit of Rs 1,777 crore is 68% higher YoY, while revenue rose 8% YoY to Rs 16,740 crore.

title: UltraTech Cement Q3 Results: Net profit surges 68% YoY to Rs 1,777 crore, meets estimates
content: Revenue from operations during the third quarter rose 8% year-on-year (YoY) to Rs 16,740 crore against Rs 15,521 crore in the corresponding quarter of last year.

title: Bulls in Action! Nifty crosses 21,600 for the first time; Sensex rises nearly 500 points tracking global market mood
content: From the Sensex pack, UltraTech Cement, Power Grid and Tata Motors were the top gainers, rising over 1% each. JSW Steel, Infosys, Tata Steel, and L&T also opened higher. On the other hand, only HDFC Bank and Sun Pharma opened lower.

title: Share market update: Most active stocks of the day in terms of total traded value
content: The NSE Nifty index was trading 75.1 points  down  at 20831.3

title: Mcap of BSE-listed firms reaches record high of Rs 297.94 lakh cr
content: The market capitalization of BSE-listed firms reached a record high of Rs 297.94 lakh crore as the benchmark Sensex crossed the 65,000 mark for the first time ever. The BSE benchmark has been rallying for the fourth straight trading session. The market capitalization of BSE-listed companies jumped to Rs 2,97,94,780.47 crore. HDFC, HDFC Bank, UltraTech Cement, Tata Steel, Bajaj Finance, ICICI Bank, and State Bank of India were among the major gainers. Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPIs) bought equities worth Rs 6,397.13 crore on Friday. GST collections crossed Rs 1.60 lakh crore mark in June.

title: UltraTech Cement Q4 Results: Profit tanks 36% YoY to Rs 1,666 crore; dividend declared at Rs 38/share
content: Revenue from operations during the fourth quarter rose 18% to Rs 18,562 crore against Rs 15,767 crore reported in the same period last year.

title: Stocks in news: Axis Bank, Wipro, UltraTech Cement, Tech Mahindra, SBI Cards, SpiceJet
content: Private sector lender Axis Bank today reported a loss of Rs 5,728.42 crore in the March quarter on account of the acquisition of Citibank India's consumer business. Excluding the one-time hit due to the deal, the bank made a net profit of Rs 6,625 crore in Q4, a growth of 61% YoY.

title: Stocks in news: HCL Tech, Adani Ports, ICICI Securities, Equitas SFB, Tata Motors
content: The Nifty futures on the Singapore Exchange were up by 0.14%, indicating a positive start to domestic equities. HCL Tech, Tata Communications, ICICI Securities, Adani Ports, ICICI Pru Life, Cyient, Laxmi Organic Industries, Equitas Small Finance Bank, UltraTech Cement, NBCC, Bank Of Maharashtra, and Mastek were among the stocks that will be in focus for various reasons.

title: Hot Stocks: Brokerages on UltraTech Cements, GAIL India, and Cipla
content: Goldman Sachs maintained its buy rating on UltraTech Cements with a target price of Rs 8500. The global investment bank is seeing improved visibility on growth, and the valuations are now looking more attractive.

title: Share market update: Most active stocks of the day in terms of total traded value
content: The NSE Nifty index was trading 44.05 points  down  at 17991.8

title: UltraTech Cement Q3 Results: Profit drops 38% YoY to Rs 1,058 crore, revenue up 19.5%
content: The company's operating margin dropped to 15% in Q3 from 19% in the year-ago period but was up 100 bps sequentially. Volume growth was strong during the quarter but cost pressures resulted in subdued margins.

title: Stocks in the news: Nykaa, Baja Auto, UltraTech, Paytm, BEL and Blue Dart
content: Private equity firm TPG Capital will sell shares of Nykaa at floor price of Rs Rs 184.55 apiece worth Rs 1,000 crore through a block deal, according to reports. Citigroup is the banker to the deal.

title: UltraTech Cement Q2 Preview: Earnings seen languishing on weak prices, demand
content: Estimates given by analysts show that the cement major’s consolidated net profit could fall up to 38% from the year-ago number of Rs 1,314 crore.

title: Cement Sector Q2 preview: Weak quarter due to monsoon, better days are yet to come!
content: Revival of retail and institutional demands on the back of receding monsoon and pick up in construction activities owing to lower prices of building raw materials are likely to aid cement companies going ahead

title: Share market update: Most active stocks of the day in terms of traded value
content: The NSE Nifty index closed 114.2 points  up  at 16719.45

title: UltraTech Cement Q1 Results: Profit falls 7% YoY to Rs 1,582 crore but beats estimates
content: UltraTech's revenue was higher in the quarter under review at Rs 15,163.98 crore as against Rs 11,829.84 crore reported in Q1 of FY22. Revenue figure also managed to beat the Street as an ET NOW poll had estimated the figure at Rs 14,238 crore. The top line was higher by 22 per cent on a YoY basis.

title: UltraTech capex plans spook cement stocks
content: Cement stocks fell between 3% and 10% on Friday amidst investor concerns that UltraTech Cement's capital expenditure plans on the heels of the Adani Group's acquisition of Holcim's cement assets signal increased competitive intensity, additional capacities, and more pricing pressure in the sector.

title: Share market update: Most active stocks of the day in terms of traded value
content: The NSE Nifty index closed 43.7 points  down  at 16584.3

title: What UltraTech's Rs 12,886 cr capex plan means for cement stocks
content: UltraTech Cement has announced plans to add 22.6 mpta of capacity which would be nearly 17 per cent of its capacity post completion of projects on-hand by FY25. The cement maker, analysts said, had already hinted at plans firming up towards organic expansions and therefore the new capex announcement does not come as a major surprise.

title: Share market update: Most active stocks of the day in terms of total traded value
content: The NSE Nifty index was trading 129.05 points  up  at 16757.05

title: Mutual funds raise stake in TCS, Infosys, 2 other IT stocks; FIIs cut. Who's smart?
content: In the June quarter, mutual funds boosted investments in leading IT stocks like Infosys and TCS, while FIIs reduced their stakes. Experts highlighted improved profits and positive future prospects driven by BFSI recovery and AI advancements.

title: D-St investors add Rs 7 lakh crore to kitty as Nifty ends at record high; Sensex soars 1,293 points
content: Sensex News: On Friday, the Sensex surged nearly 1,300 points, while the Nifty50 reached a record high, driven by broad-based buying despite concerns over the capital gains tax hike in the Budget. The total market capitalization of BSE-listed companies increased by Rs 7.16 lakh crore to Rs 456.98 lakh crore. Information technology stocks, including Mphasis, LTIMindtree, and Infosys, saw gains of up to 7% following positive U.S. economic growth data for the second quarter.

title: Wipro goes for a tumble, may stay weak in near term
content: Wipro Share Price: Wipro shares fell 9% due to poor Q1 results, predicted to underperform Infosys and Tata Consultancy Services. The Nifty IT Index declined 0.38%, with Tech Mahindra gaining 0.11%. Morgan Stanley and 5paisa foresee more weakness and long position unwinding. JM Financial advises caution amid weak fundamentals, with Mohit Jain highlighting poor guidance.

title: Wipro shares plunge over 7% post Q1 results. Should you buy, sell or hold?
content: Wipro's shares dropped by over 7% despite a 4.6% YoY rise in net profit for the quarter ended June 2024. The revenue from operations saw a 4% decline compared to the same quarter last year. Brokerages have mixed views on Wipro's performance and growth prospects.

title: Share market update: Most active stocks of the day in terms of total traded value
content: The NSE Nifty index was trading 8.25 points  down  at 24522.65

title: Sensex falls over 300 pts as RIL & bank stocks tumble, Nifty below 24,400
content: Ahead of the budget, Indian markets fell. Sensex dropped 355 points, Nifty50 by 148 points. Reliance fell 2.5% from lower fuel margins; HDFC Bank, the country's top private lender, rose 1% after beating profit forecasts; Wipro dropped 8% due to weak demand in Europe and Asia-Pacific. Mixed performance among key stocks in early trading.

title: Q1 Results Today: What to expect from HDFC Bank and Kotak Bank’s earnings
content: HDFC Bank's Q1 FY25 financial results are likely to be less impressive than the previous quarter, primarily due to slower deposit growth. The merger with HDFC Ltd. makes year-over-year comparisons irrelevant. Loan growth is also expected to moderate, impacting net interest income. While the bank navigates the challenges of integration and a tougher economic environment, its profitability might see a minor dip in this quarter.

title: Deal wins help Wipro, no revival in demand soon
content: Wipro's June growth met forecasts but missed analysts' expectations. IT services revenue fell 1.2% to $2,625.9M. Despite declines in energy, utilities, technology, and communications, margins and new deal wins were resilient. BFSI grew; September guidance is optimistic, excluding currency fluctuations. Attrition fell, headcount rose first in six quarters; consumer vertical grew.

title: Wipro ADRs fall nearly 12% on Q1 revenue drop even as PAT beats estimates
content: The IT major exceeded analysts' expectations with a consolidated net profit of Rs 3,003 crore for the quarter ending June 30, 2024. This marks a 4.6% increase compared to that in the same period last year.

title: Wipro maintains momentum in deal wins amid a tough quarter
content: ​​Like some of the larger peers, it showed a marginal uptick in the banking, financial services, and insurance (BFSI) vertical, the largest vertical contributing 34% to the revenue durng the quarter. While its revenue guidance for the September quarter looks a bit more optimistic than its forecast for the June quarter, demand revival is likely to take a few more quarters.

title: Wipro Q1 Results: Cons PAT rises 5% YoY to Rs 3,003 cr, revenue drops 4%
content: Wipro Q1 Results: The IT major's Q4 revenue dipped 4% to Rs 21,964 crore, falling short of analyst expectations of Rs 22,258 crore. The IT services segment experienced a 1.2% decline in revenue at $2,625.9 million, compared to the previous quarter. It dropped 5.5% when compared to the same quarter last year. After non-GAAP and constant currency adjustments, the revenue showed a drop of 1% QoQ and 4.9% YoY.

title: D-Street bulls struggle to keep up with record-breaking rally; Infosys, RIL in focus
content: Indian indices Sensex and Nifty50 peaked at record highs of 81,587 and 24,850 before dropping, dragged by energy and financial stocks. Sensex rose 146 points, Nifty50 gained 59 points. Infosys surged 3% post US share hike, boosting FY25 outlook. Tech Mahindra, Power Grid, Tata Steel, NTPC, JSW Steel lagged. HCL Tech, Asian Paints, HDFC Bank benefited from demand recovery.

title: Q1 results today: RIL, Wipro, Paytm among 51 companies to announce earnings on Friday
content: Q1 results today: Several major companies, including Reliance Industries, Wipro, and Paytm, are set to announce their first quarter results today. Expectations range from profit growth to revenue declines across different sectors. Investors are advised to stay informed and watch out for key updates.

title: Indices hit new highs, Sensex closes above 81K for first time
content: BSE Sensex hit 81,343.46, NSE Nifty 24,800.85, driven by large-cap IT stocks like Infosys, TCS, Wipro. Bank Nifty rose 0.4%, VIX gained 2.02%. Small and mid-caps saw profit-taking. Rajesh Palviya and Andrew Holland noted strong IT results. Infosys' Q1 results awaited. Union Budget on July 23 may further influence markets.

title: Stocks in news: RIL, Wipro, Paytm, Infosys, Tata Technologies
content: Nifty50 reaches 24,800; RIL, Wipro, Infosys, Tata Technologies reveal first-quarter results. Vodafone Idea issues Rs 615 crore in equity shares. Infosys records 3.6% revenue growth, broad-based in constant currency. Tata Technologies' profit falls 15%. CIE Automotive earns Rs 217 crore. JSW Steel's results await.

title: Infosys ADRs jump over 9% after robust Q1 numbers; that of Wipro up 4%
content: Following a strong Q1 performance and positive momentum in financial services deals in North America, the company has revised its FY25 revenue growth guidance upwards, projecting a 3-4% increase in constant currency, compared to the previous 1-3% estimate. This upward revision reflects increased confidence in the company's outlook for the remainder of the fiscal year.

title: Sensex jumps over 600 points to cross 81,000: 5 factors behind the rally
content: In recent days, Dalal Street has been renewing its vows for old-favourite software stocks. The Nifty IT index jumped over 2%, with LTIMindtree, TCS, Wipro, Infosys, Coforge, and HCL Tech rallying between 2-4% each. The results of Infosys today will give greater clarity to the movement in IT stocks.

title: Wipro Q1 results preview: Net profit may rise 4% year-on-year; revenue to fall due to continued weakness in verticals
content: Wipro Q1 Results: Wipro's Q1 revenue likely to decline by 2% year-on-year, with net profit expected to grow by 4%. Analysts are keeping an eye on consulting business performance and large deal pipeline. Company aiming for cost containment and efficiency measures to boost margins.

title: Q1 results this week: RIL, Paytm, Infosys, Jio Financial among 418 companies to announce quarterly earnings
content: Several widely followed companies, including Jio Financial, Paytm, Bajaj Auto, Asian Paints, LTIMindtree, Infosys, Reliance Industries, Wipro, Union Bank of India, Kotak Mahindra Bank, Tanla Platform, Tata Technologies, and YES Bank, will be releasing their June quarter report cards this week.

title: US inflation data, IT stocks propel Indian indices to fresh highs
content: The NSE Nifty rose 186.20 points, or 0.77%, to close at 24,502.15, having hit a lifetime high of 24,592.20 during the day. The BSE Sensex rose 622 points, or 0.78%, to end at 80,519.34, down from an intraday record of 80,893.51.

title: IT stocks surge up to 6% led by midcap counter Mphasis as TCS Q1 cheers D-Street
content: Indian IT stocks surged due to TCS's robust June quarter earnings. The Nifty IT index rose 3.7%. Infosys and TCS led gains with Rs 62,613 crore revenue and Rs 12,040 crore net profit. MphasiS had notable intraday gains, while HCL Technologies showed growth. TCS forecasts better FY25 performance.

title: Heat wave, elections to create unlikely earnings winners and losers
content: India's scorching summer impacts Avenue Supermarts Ltd. and Bajaj Auto Ltd. DMart sells more ice cream, while Bajaj Auto defers purchases and introduces a new CNG-powered motorcycle, with its slowest profit expansion in April-June quarter. Nirmala Sitharaman may boost consumption. Infosys, Wipro, TCS benefit from AI demand and partnerships.

title: Sensex, Nifty end flat after scaling fresh highs; HDFC Bank plays spoilsport
content: The Nifty breadth was skewed in the favour of the bears, with 27 stocks ending in the red, while 23 ended in positive territory. Top gainers at the close included Tata Motors, HCL Technologies, ICICI Bank, Sun Pharmaceuticals, and Tata Consultancy Services (TCS).

title: IT stocks rally up to 32% in 1 month. Will Q1 results mark end of sluggish revenue growth?
content: IT sector experiences bullish rally ahead of Q1 results with Tech Mahindra, Coforge, and Infosys emerging as top stock recommendations.

title: Nomura turns bullish on Indian IT sector, highlights Infosys, Coforge as top picks
content: Nomura bullish on Indian IT sector with top picks Infosys and Coforge, upgrades ratings for Wipro and HCL Technologies. Anticipates GenAI adoption boosting cloud services demand.

title: U-Turn: Sensex, Nifty erase gains after hitting record highs
content: From the Sensex pack, Infosys, HCL Tech, TCS, and Bharti Airtel opened higher, while Tata Motors, Kotak Mahindra Bank, Bajaj Finance, and ICICI Bank opened in the red.Shares of Kotak Mahindra dropped 2% after US short-seller Hindenburg said that the lender created and oversaw a fund that Hindenburg investors used to short Adani stocks.

title: Infosys, Tech Mahindra among 6 IT stocks that could surprise positively in Q1 results: JM Financial
content: Stating that Tech Mahindra remains a ‘buy' on turnaround hopes while KPIT Technologies and Tata Technologies are structural bets on auto ER&D theme, domestic brokerage firm JM Financial believes that Q1 results for the IT sector could positively surprise the street.

title: Banking stocks lift Sensex, Nifty to new heights in July opening
content: D-Sreet closed on a positive note on Monday, with the S&P BSE Sensex gaining 443.46 points to settle at 79,476.19. The broader Nifty index also rose, adding 131.35 points to close at 24,141.95. The banking sector showed particular strength, with the banking gauge up by 0.44%. Tech Mahindra, Wipro, Bajaj Finance, Grasim Industries, and UltraTech Cement were among the top gainers, while NTPC, Eicher Motors, Apollo Hospitals Enterprise, SBI, and Dr. Reddy's Laboratories experienced declines. Market capitalisation of all the BSE listed companies increased by Rs 344,798 crore.

title: Wipro shares jump over 3% after double upgrade from CLSA
content: Wipro's stock witnessed a 21.2% surge in the last month, contributing to a 36.5% increase over the past year, with an 11% rise in the current calendar year.

title: Sensex extends record rally to 3rd session, ends above 79K, Nifty tops 24,000
content: Heavyweights RIL, HDFC Bank, and ICICI Bank were among the biggest contributors to Nifty's rise. Sectorally, buying was noticed in banks, FMCG, metals, and pharma. For Nifty50, the latest 1,000-point gain from 23,000 to 24,000 has been the 2nd fastest ever. Nifty took 23 sessions to climb 1,000 points.

title: Adani Ports enters Sensex, Wipro exits as part of semi-annual rejig
content: Adani Ports joins Sensex as Wipro exits. The inclusion of APSEZ brings $259 million in passive inflows. Seven stocks' weights to rise: Bharti Airtel, Infosys, Kotak Mahindra Bank, ICICI Bank, Tech Mahindra, Tata Steel, and IndusInd Bank.

title: Stocks in news: Adani Ports, Cipla, Prestige Estates, MCX, Lupin
content: Positive growth in domestic markets for the third consecutive week with a focus on Adani Ports, Cipla, Prestige Estates, MCX, Lupin. Updates on Thomas Cook India, SAIL, Wipro, Prestige Estates, Lupin, Cipla, MCX, TVS Motor, CSC Grameen eStores.

title: Adani Ports to enter Sensex on Monday, Wipro to exit as part of semi-annual rejig
content: Adani Ports’ Sensex inclusion will trigger passive inflows of $259 million and 14.9 million shares are expected to be added, according to Nuvama’s estimates. Wipro’s exclusion could see outflows of $170 million.

title: IT stocks rally up to 4% as an early indicator of Q1 earnings just gave green signals
content: Indian IT stocks surged following positive results from Accenture, with Persistent Systems leading the gains. Analysts expect a strong demand environment to drive healthy earnings growth.

title: Tech heavyweights drive Sensex over 150 points higher, Nifty above 23,600
content: Indian benchmark equity indices opened higher led by information technology stocks after U.S. IT firm Accenture forecasted annual revenue growth above expectations.
